We know he is dead and that he was unarmed.Â But no, we don't yet know that he was gunned down.Â Â While it is true that it seems reasonable to conclude that nothing would have happened wihtout Zimmerman being suspicious of a black male walking in his neighbourhood, that just isn't the same as saying he gunned him down.Â Â There was a confrontation and the armed man shot the unarmed kid.Â Murder?Â That has yet to be proven.
You don't know that the system had failed to move.Â Zimmerman was arrested and charges were considered.Â Â In the immediate aftermath of Martin's death charges were not laid but you don't know whether at that moment a decision had been to NEVER lay charges.Â Â
I'm not being cynical and Cold and neither are the many like Weisbrot who are cautioning against a rush to judgement and a gutting of due process, the preumption of innocence and all the other Safeguards that are there for good reason.
Now, as for your linkage, could it be that the death of Jews in Paris allegedly at the hands of Hassan Diab doesn't really matter to you?
